org.cloudifysource.dsl.cloud
Class CloudTemplate

java.lang.Object
  org.cloudifysource.dsl.cloud.CloudTemplate

public class CloudTemplate
extends Object

Since:
2.0.0 A cloud template is a group of settings that define a given configuration, available for a specific cloud. It can include physical machine properties (e.g. memory), operating system type, location, available cloud nodes and other settings.
Author:
barakme

isPrivileged

public boolean isPrivileged()
True if services running in this template should have privileged access. This usually means that the service will run with higher Operating System permissions - root/sudoer on Linux, Administrator on Windows. Default is false.

Returns:
true if services on this template will run in privileged mode.

setPrivileged

public void setPrivileged(boolean privileged)

getInitializationCommand

public String getInitializationCommand()
A command line that will be executed before the bootstrapping process of a machine from this template ends (before the Cloudify agent starts, after JDK and Cloudify are installed).

Returns:
the initialization command line.
